option.name: updatedContent
option.value: /* * ======================================== * ENEMY HEALTH BAR - SETUP GUIDE * ======================================== * * STEP 1: CREATE THE HEALTH BAR UI PREFAB * ======================================== * * 1. Create a new Canvas in your scene (if testing) or in a prefab: * - Right-click in Hierarchy > UI > Canvas * - Set Canvas to "World Space" (not Screen Space!) * - Set Canvas RenderMode: World Space * - Set Canvas Size: X=2, Y=0.5 (or adjust to your liking) * * 2. Add a CanvasGroup component to the Canvas: * - Select the Canvas * - Add Component > Canvas Group * - This allows us to fade the health bar in/out * * 3. Create the background: * - Right-click Canvas > UI > Image * - Name it "HealthBar_Background" * - Anchor: Stretch/Stretch (fill parent) * - Color: Black or dark gray with some transparency (e.g., RGB: 0,0,0, A: 100) * - Add some padding if you want (Left:5, Right:5, Top:5, Bottom:5) * * 4. Create the health fill bar: * - Right-click Background > UI > Image * - Name it "HealthBar_Fill" * - Anchor: Stretch/Stretch * - Set Margins: Left:5, Right:5, Top:5, Bottom:5 (creates padding) * - Color: Green (or any color you like) * - Image Type: Filled * - Fill Method: Horizontal * - Fill Origin: Left * - Fill Amount: 1 (this will be controlled by script) * * 5. Add the EnemyHealthBar script: * - Select the Canvas (root of the health bar) * - Add Component > EnemyHealthBar * - Assign references: * * Health Bar Fill: Drag the "HealthBar_Fill" image here * * Canvas Group: Drag the Canvas (with CanvasGroup component) here * - Adjust settings: * * Hide Delay: 2 (seconds before fading out) * * Fade Speed: 2 (how fast it fades) * * 6. Position the health bar above the enemy: * - Select the Canvas * - Set Position: X=0, Y=1.5, Z=0 (adjust Y to be above enemy head) * - Set Rotation: X=0, Y=0, Z=0 * - Set Scale: X=0.005, Y=0.005, Z=0.005 (much smaller for compact bar) * * 7. Save as prefab: * - Drag the Canvas from Hierarchy to your Prefabs folder * - Name it "EnemyHealthBar_Prefab" * - Delete the Canvas from the scene (you'll instantiate it on enemies) * * ======================================== * STEP 2: ADD HEALTH BAR TO ENEMY PREFAB * ======================================== * * 1. Open your enemy prefab (Ghost, Enemy, etc.) * * 2. Drag the "EnemyHealthBar_Prefab" into the enemy prefab: * - Drag it as a child of the enemy root * - Position it above the enemy (Y=2 or wherever looks good) * * 3. Select the enemy root and find the EnemyHealth component: * - In the Inspector, find the "Health Bar" field * - Drag the EnemyHealthBar_Prefab (the child you just added) into this slot * * 4. Save the prefab * * ======================================== * STEP 3: TEST * ======================================== * * 1. Enter Play mode * 2. Spawn an enemy * 3. The health bar should be invisible at first * 4. When the enemy takes damage: * - Health bar appears (fades in) * - Shows current health percentage * - Changes color: Green > Yellow > Red * - After 2 seconds of no damage, fades out * * ======================================== * QUICK ALTERNATIVE (NO CANVAS) * ======================================== * * If you want an even simpler approach using a 3D quad: * * 1. Create a Quad (3D Object > Quad) * 2. Create a material with a texture or color * 3. Use a shader that supports transparency * 4. Scale the quad using localScale in the EnemyHealthBar script * 5. This is lighter but less flexible than UI * * ======================================== * TROUBLESHOOTING * ======================================== * * Health bar not showing: * - Check that Canvas is set to "World Space" * - Check that CanvasGroup is assigned * - Check that Health Bar Fill image is assigned * - Check that enemy has EnemyHealth script with healthBar reference * * Health bar too big/small: * - Adjust Canvas scale (try 0.01 for all axes) * - Adjust Canvas size (try 2x0.5) * * Health bar facing wrong direction: * - The script automatically rotates to face camera in LateUpdate * - Make sure Camera.main is set correctly * * Health bar not fading: * - Check that CanvasGroup component is on the Canvas * - Check that it's assigned in the EnemyHealthBar script * * ======================================== */

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# PLANT PREFAB - COMPLETE SETUP GUIDE
## WHAT GOES INTO THE PLANT PREFAB
The PlantPrefab is a **GameObject** that represents a planted crop in your game. It needs these components:
---
## REQUIRED COMPONENTS
### **1. GameObject (Base)** - Name: "PlantPrefab" - Position: (0, 0, 0) - Rotation: (0, 0, 0) - Scale: (1, 1, 1)
### **2. SpriteRenderer** ✅ REQUIRED - **What it does:** Displays the plant sprite (changes during growth) - **Settings:** - Sprite: Leave empty (set by PlantGrowth script) - Color: White (255, 255, 255, 255) - Material: Sprites-Default - Sorting Layer: Default - Order in Layer: 10 (renders above ground)
### **3. PlantGrowth Script** ✅ REQUIRED - **What it does:** Manages growth phases, watering, and sprite changes - **Settings:** None to configure (all handled in code)
### **4. Collider** ✅ REQUIRED (for detection) **Choose ONE of these options:**
#### **Option A: BoxCollider (3D game)** - Size: (0.5, 1, 0.5) or (1, 1, 1) - Center: (0, 0.5, 0) - Is Trigger: ✅ Checked
#### **Option B: SphereCollider (3D game)** - Radius: 0.5 - Center: (0, 0.5, 0) - Is Trigger: ✅ Checked
#### **Option C: BoxCollider2D (2D game)** - Size: (1, 1) - Offset: (0, 0.5) - Is Trigger: ✅ Checked
### **5. Tag** ✅ REQUIRED - Tag: **"Plant"** (must be exactly this!)
---
## STEP-BY-STEP CREATION
### **METHOD 1: Manual Setup (5 minutes)**
1. **Create Empty GameObject** - Hierarchy → Right-click → Create Empty - Name it "PlantPrefab"
2. **Add SpriteRenderer** - Select PlantPrefab - Inspector → Add Component → SpriteRenderer - Leave Sprite empty - Set Sorting Order to 10
3. **Add PlantGrowth Script** - Inspector → Add Component - Search: "PlantGrowth" - Click to add
4. **Add Collider** - Inspector → Add Component - Choose: Box Collider (or Sphere Collider) - Set Size: (0.5, 1, 0.5) - Set Center: (0, 0.5, 0) - ✅ Check "Is Trigger"
5. **Set Tag** - Top of Inspector → Tag dropdown - If "Plant" doesn't exist: - Select "Add Tag..." - Click "+" → Type "Plant" - Click Save - Go back to PlantPrefab - Set Tag to "Plant"
6. **Save as Prefab** - Drag PlantPrefab from Hierarchy into Project → Prefabs folder - Blue cube icon appears (it's now a prefab!) - Delete PlantPrefab from Hierarchy
---
### **METHOD 2: Auto Setup Script (1 minute)**
I created a helper script for you! Use it like this:
1. **Create empty GameObject** in scene 2. **Add PlantPrefabSetup script** to it 3. **Right-click the script** in Inspector 4. **Click "Setup This As Plant Prefab"** 5. **Done!** All components auto-added 6. **Save as prefab**, delete from scene
---
## COMPONENT HIERARCHY
``` PlantPrefab ├─ Transform │ └─ Position: (0, 0, 0) ├─ SpriteRenderer │ ├─ Sprite: (none - set by script) │ ├─ Sorting Order: 10 │ └─ Material: Sprites-Default ├─ PlantGrowth (Script) │ └─ (Automatically manages growth) ├─ Box Collider │ ├─ Size: (0.5, 1, 0.5) │ ├─ Center: (0, 0.5, 0) │ └─ Is Trigger: ✅ └─ Tag: "Plant" ```
---
## VISUAL SETUP
### **In Inspector, it should look like:**
``` ┌─────────────────────────────────────┐ │ PlantPrefab │ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Tag: Plant ▼ Layer: Default ▼│ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Transform │ │ Position X:0 Y:0 Z:0 │ │ Rotation X:0 Y:0 Z:0 │ │ Scale X:1 Y:1 Z:1 │ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Sprite Renderer │ │ Sprite None (Sprite) │ │ Color ⬜ 255,255,255,255 │ │ Flip □X □Y │ │ Material Sprites-Default │ │ Sorting Layer Default │ │ Order in Layer 10 │ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Plant Growth (Script) │ │ Script PlantGrowth │ │ (No public fields to configure) │ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Box Collider │ │ Is Trigger ✅ │ │ Material None │ │ Center X:0 Y:0.5 Z:0 │ │ Size X:0.5 Y:1 Z:0.5 │ └─────────────────────────────────────┘ ```
---
## ⚙️ WHY EACH COMPONENT IS NEEDED
### **SpriteRenderer:** - Displays the visible plant sprite - Script changes sprite during growth phases - Sorting order 10 = renders above ground
### **PlantGrowth Script:** - Handles growth timer - Changes sprites (planted → growing → grown) - Manages watering state - Spawns turrets for special seeds
### **Collider:** - GameGrid uses OverlapSphere to detect plants - Must be trigger so it doesn't block movement - Centered at 0.5 Y so it's above ground level
### **"Plant" Tag:** - GameGrid searches for this tag - Used in HasPlant() and WaterPlant() methods - Must match exactly (case-sensitive)
---
## TESTING THE PREFAB
### **Quick Test:**
1. **Drag PlantPrefab** into scene 2. **Check Inspector:** - ✅ SpriteRenderer present - ✅ PlantGrowth script present - ✅ Collider present (Is Trigger checked) - ✅ Tag = "Plant" 3. **Delete** from scene (just testing)
### **Test in Play Mode:**
1. Press Play 2. Buy a seed from shop 3. Walk to farmland 4. Click "Plant" 5. **Plant should spawn** with small sprite 6. Click "Water" 7. **Wait** → sprite should change
---
## ❌ COMMON MISTAKES
### **Mistake 1: No Collider** **Error:** "Plant" button never appears **Fix:** Add BoxCollider, set Is Trigger ✅
### **Mistake 2: Wrong Tag** **Error:** GameGrid can't find the plant **Fix:** Set Tag to exactly "Plant" (capital P)
### **Mistake 3: Collider Not Trigger** **Error:** Player can't walk through plants **Fix:** Check "Is Trigger" on collider
### **Mistake 4: No SpriteRenderer** **Error:** Plant is invisible **Fix:** Add SpriteRenderer component
### **Mistake 5: Wrong Sorting Order** **Error:** Plant renders under ground **Fix:** Set Sorting Order to 10 or higher
---
## FINAL CHECKLIST
Before saving as prefab:
- [ ] GameObject named "PlantPrefab" - [ ] SpriteRenderer added (Sprite = empty is OK) - [ ] PlantGrowth script added - [ ] Collider added (BoxCollider or SphereCollider) - [ ] Collider "Is Trigger" is ✅ checked - [ ] Collider centered at (0, 0.5, 0) or similar - [ ] Tag set to "Plant" - [ ] Saved in Prefabs folder - [ ] Deleted from scene
---
## ASSIGN TO GAMEGRID
After creating the prefab:
1. Select **GridManager** in Hierarchy 2. Find **GameGrid** script in Inspector 3. Find **Planting System** section 4. Drag **PlantPrefab** into the **Plant Prefab** field 5. ✅ Done!
---
## RELATED
- **PlantGrowth.cs** - The script that runs on each plant - **GameGrid.cs** - Spawns plants using this prefab - **ItemData.cs** - Defines what sprites to use
---
## YOU'RE DONE!
The PlantPrefab is now ready to use in your farming system!
When you plant a seed: 1. GameGrid spawns this prefab 2. PlantGrowth initializes with ItemData 3. Sprite shows growth phases 4. Watering activates growth 5. Plant grows to maturity
**Simple and effective!** ✨

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# PLANT SPRITES - QUICK REFERENCE
## ✅ WHAT YOU NEED
For EACH seed type, create **3 sprites**:
``` 1. SMALL (planted) → (tiny sprout) 2. MEDIUM (growing) → (bigger plant) 3. LARGE (grown) → (full crop) ```
---
## SPRITE CHECKLIST
### For Each Sprite: - [ ] PNG with **transparent background** - [ ] Pivot set to **Bottom** (0.5, 0) in Sprite Editor - [ ] Progressively **larger** (planted < growing < grown) - [ ] Same **art style** for all 3 phases - [ ] Saved in your project
---
## IMPORT SETTINGS
1. Select sprite 2. Texture Type: **Sprite (2D and UI)** 3. Pixels Per Unit: **100** 4. Filter Mode: **Point** (pixel art) or **Bilinear** (smooth) 5. Compression: **None** 6. **Apply** 7. Open **Sprite Editor** → Set Pivot to **Bottom**
---
## ITEMDATA SETUP
``` ItemData Settings: ├─ Item Name: "Carrot Seed" ├─ Item Type: Seed ├─ Buy Cost: 50 ├─ Growth Time: 1 ├─ Planted Phase Sprite: [ small sprite] ├─ Growing Phase Sprite: [ medium sprite] └─ Grown Phase Sprite: [ large sprite] ```
---
## HOW IT LOOKS
``` After Planting + Watering: (small sprite shows) [grass tile] (grass stays visible)
After 15 seconds: (medium sprite shows) [grass tile]
After 30 seconds total: (large sprite shows) [grass tile] (ready to harvest!) ```
---
## ADJUSTED HEIGHT?
If sprites too high/low, edit **GameGrid.cs** line ~270: ```csharp Vector3.up * 0.5f ← Change 0.5 to 0.3 (lower) or 0.7 (higher) ```
---
## ✨ TIPS
- **Size:** Each phase should be noticeably bigger - **Color:** Can change slightly as it grows - **Detail:** Add more detail in later phases - **Test:** Use colored circles first, replace with art later
---
## MORE INFO
- **Detailed guide:** SPRITE_SETUP_GUIDE.md - **Visual examples:** UPDATED_PLANT_SYSTEM.md

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# PLANT SPRITE REFERENCE & SETUP
## Available Plant Sprites in Your Project
Located in: `Assets/Sprites/Zemlja/`
### Plant Growth Sprites: 1. **srednji_rast_biljke.png** - Middle growth phase (for 2-day plants) 2. **paradajz_stabiljka.png** - Tomato plant (full grown) 3. **kukuruz_stabiljka.png** - Corn plant (full grown) 4. **cesnjak_stabiljka.png** - Garlic plant (full grown)
### Ground Sprites: 1. **suha_prazna_zemlja_kao.png** - Dry empty ground 2. **mokra_zemlja_sa_smejkama01.png** - Wet ground with worms 3. **ona_mozebitno_dobra_mokra02.png** - Alternative wet ground
## QUICK SETUP FOR EACH SEED TYPE
### Tomato Seed (1-Day Fast Crop) ``` ItemData Settings: - Name: "Tomato Seed" - Item Type: Seed - Growth Time: 1 day - Buy Cost: 50 - Sell Value: 100 - Planted Phase: Use small version or srednji_rast_biljke.png - Grown Phase: paradajz_stabiljka.png - Seed Type: Normal ```
### Corn Seed (2-Day Slow Crop) ``` ItemData Settings: - Name: "Corn Seed" - Item Type: Seed - Growth Time: 2 days - Buy Cost: 75 - Sell Value: 200 - Planted Phase: Small sprout (use srednji_rast_biljke scaled down) - Growing Phase: srednji_rast_biljke.png - Grown Phase: kukuruz_stabiljka.png - Seed Type: Normal ```
### Garlic Seed (2-Day Slow Crop) ``` ItemData Settings: - Name: "Garlic Seed" - Item Type: Seed - Growth Time: 2 days - Buy Cost: 60 - Sell Value: 150 - Planted Phase: Small sprout - Growing Phase: srednji_rast_biljke.png - Grown Phase: cesnjak_stabiljka.png - Seed Type: Normal ```
### Turret Seed (Defense Plant) ``` ItemData Settings: - Name: "Turret Seed" - Item Type: Seed - Growth Time: 2 days - Buy Cost: 150 - Sell Value: 0 (doesn't harvest, spawns turret) - Planted Phase: Small sprout - Growing Phase: srednji_rast_biljke.png - Grown Phase: Some defensive-looking plant sprite - Seed Type: Turret - Turret Prefab: (Assign your turret prefab here) ```
## SPRITE IMPORT SETTINGS
Make sure sprites are imported correctly: 1. Select sprite in Project 2. Inspector → Texture Type: **Sprite (2D and UI)** 3. Sprite Mode: **Single** 4. Pixels Per Unit: **100** (or whatever fits your game) 5. Filter Mode: **Point (no filter)** for pixel art, or **Bilinear** for smooth 6. Compression: **None** for best quality during jam 7. Click **Apply**
## QUICK DUPLICATE WORKFLOW
### To create multiple seeds fast: 1. Create first ItemData (e.g., TomatoSeed) 2. In Project, right-click → Duplicate 3. Rename to "CornSeed" 4. Change sprites and values 5. Repeat!
## RECOMMENDED SPRITE SIZES
For consistent visuals: - **Planted sprite**: 32x32 to 64x64 pixels - **Growing sprite**: 64x64 to 128x128 pixels - **Grown sprite**: 128x128 to 256x256 pixels - **Ground tiles**: 256x256 pixels
## COLOR CODING (Optional but helpful)
You can tint the ItemData icons in the project folder: - Green tint: Normal crops - Red tint: Turret seeds - Yellow tint: Special/rare seeds
## CHECKLIST FOR EACH SEED
Before testing, make sure EACH ItemData has: - ✅ Item Name (shows in UI) - ✅ Item Icon (shows in selector button) - ✅ Item Type = Seed - ✅ Growth Time (1 or 2) - ✅ Buy/Sell costs - ✅ Planted Phase Sprite - ✅ Grown Phase Sprite - ✅ Growing Phase Sprite (only if 2-day) - ✅ Seed Type (Normal or Turret)
## FASTEST SETUP (5 MINUTES)
For game jam speed: 1. Create ONE seed (Tomato, 1-day) 2. Use **srednji_rast_biljke.png** as planted 3. Use **paradajz_stabiljka.png** as grown 4. Skip growing phase sprite (only needed for 2-day) 5. Add 10 to inventory 6. TEST IT FIRST! 7. Then create more seeds if it works
## IN-GAME VISUAL FLOW
What player sees: ``` Empty Tile (dry ground) ↓ [Click Plant] Small Sprout (planted sprite) ↓ [Click Water] Small Sprout (same, but growing) ↓ [Wait 10s for 1-day OR 20s for 2-day] Full Plant (grown sprite) ↓ [Click Harvest] Empty Tile (back to start) ```
## PRO TIPS
1. **Start with 1-day seeds** - Faster testing! 2. **Use same sprite** for planted on all seeds to save time 3. **Unique grown sprites** - Players need to see the difference 4. **High contrast** - Make sure sprites visible on ground tiles 5. **Test early** - Don't create 10 seeds before testing 1!
Good luck!

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# HOW TO SETUP SPRITES FOR PLANTS GROWING ABOVE GROUND
## ✅ UPDATED SYSTEM
The farming system now works like this: - **Grass tiles stay on the ground** (don't get destroyed) - **Plants spawn ABOVE the grass** (0.5 units up) - **Plant sprites show growth stages** (small → medium → large)
---
## SPRITE SETUP GUIDE
### **What You Need:**
For each seed type (Carrot, Pumpkin, etc.), you need **3 sprites**:
#### **1. Planted Phase (Small Sprout)** ``` Example: ← Small sprout just poking out of ground
Size: Tiny (maybe 16x16 or 32x32 pixels) This shows right after planting and watering ```
#### **2. Growing Phase (Medium Plant)** ``` Example: ← Medium-sized plant with leaves
Size: Medium (maybe 32x64 or 48x64 pixels) This shows halfway through growth ```
#### **3. Grown Phase (Fully Grown)** ``` Example: ← Full plant ready to harvest
Size: Large (maybe 64x64 or 64x128 pixels) This shows when ready to harvest ```
---
## SPRITE REQUIREMENTS
### **Transparency:** - ✅ Background must be **transparent** (PNG with alpha) - ✅ Plant should be centered in the sprite - ✅ Leave space at bottom for "root" area
### **Pivot Point:** - ✅ Set pivot to **Bottom Center** (0.5, 0) - This makes the plant "grow" upward from the ground - In Unity: Select sprite → Sprite Editor → Pivot → Bottom
### **Size Progression:** ``` Planted: Small () - Just a sprout ↓ Growing: Medium () - Growing leaves ↓ Grown: Large () - Full crop ```
---
## HOW IT LOOKS IN GAME
``` Side View:
Grass Tile: [=========] ← Stays visible ↑ (0.5 units up) ↑ Plant Sprite: ← Phase 1: Planted ← Phase 2: Growing ← Phase 3: Grown ```
``` Timeline:
Plant Seed Water Wait 15s Wait 15s ↓ ↓ ↓ ↓ [Dirt] → [Dirt] → [Dirt] → [Dirt] tiny medium large (planted) (growing) (grown) ```
---
## EXAMPLE SPRITE SETUPS
### **Carrot:** - **Planted:** Small green sprout (2-3 leaves) - **Growing:** Bigger leaves, hint of orange - **Grown:** Full carrot with leaves poking up
### **Pumpkin:** - **Planted:** Tiny vine sprout - **Growing:** Vine with small pumpkin - **Grown:** Large pumpkin on vine
### **Turret (Special):** - **Planted:** Seed sprouting - **Growing:** Strange plant growing - **Grown:** Turret plant ready (then spawns actual turret)
---
## UNITY SETUP
### **For Each Sprite:**
1. **Import sprite** into Unity 2. **Select sprite** in Project window 3. **Inspector settings:** - Texture Type: **Sprite (2D and UI)** - Sprite Mode: **Single** - Pixels Per Unit: **100** (or your game's standard) - Filter Mode: **Point (no filter)** for pixel art, or **Bilinear** for smooth - Compression: **None** for best quality 4. **Apply** 5. **Open Sprite Editor:** - Click "Sprite Editor" button - Set **Pivot** to **Bottom** (0.5, 0) - Apply 6. **Assign to ItemData:** - Open your ItemData ScriptableObject - Drag sprite to appropriate field: - Small → Planted Phase Sprite - Medium → Growing Phase Sprite - Large → Grown Phase Sprite
---
## ARTISTIC TIPS
### **Visual Clarity:** - Make each phase **noticeably different** in size - Use **color progression** (darker/lighter as it grows) - Add **detail progression** (simple → detailed)
### **Style Consistency:** - Keep same art style for all phases - Use same color palette - Match your game's aesthetic (pixel art, hand-drawn, etc.)
### **Size Ratios:** ``` Good progression: Planted: 25% of grown size Growing: 60% of grown size Grown: 100% size ```
---
## TESTING YOUR SPRITES
1. **Create ItemData** with your 3 sprites assigned 2. **Add to inventory** (using FarmingSystemTester: Press S) 3. **Plant the seed** 4. **Check:** Does small sprite show? ✅ 5. **Water the plant** 6. **Wait 15 seconds:** Does medium sprite show? ✅ 7. **Wait 15 more seconds:** Does large sprite show? ✅
---
## ⚙️ ADJUSTING SPAWN HEIGHT
If your sprites are too high/low:
**In GameGrid.cs, change this line:** ```csharp Vector3 plantPosition = selectedTile.transform.position + Vector3.up * 0.5f; ↑ Change this number ```
- **0.5f** = Default (0.5 units above ground) - **0.3f** = Lower (closer to ground) - **0.7f** = Higher (floating more) - **1.0f** = Very high (for tall sprites)
---
## COMMON SPRITE ISSUES
### **Problem: Sprite is upside down** **Fix:** In Sprite Editor, rotate sprite or change pivot
### **Problem: Sprite is cut off at bottom** **Fix:** Change pivot to Bottom (0.5, 0)
### **Problem: Sprite is too small/big** **Fix:** - Adjust Pixels Per Unit in import settings - Or scale the sprite in your art program
### **Problem: Sprite is blurry** **Fix:** - Set Filter Mode to "Point (no filter)" for pixel art - Or increase sprite resolution
### **Problem: Can't see plant after planting** **Fix:** - Check sprite has alpha transparency - Check SpriteRenderer sorting order (should be 10) - Check plant spawned above ground (Y position > 0)
---
## WHAT CHANGED IN THE CODE
I updated the system so:
1. **Grass tiles don't get destroyed** - They stay visible 2. **Plants spawn 0.5 units above ground** - So sprites are visible 3. **SpriteRenderer sorting order = 10** - Renders above ground 4. **HasPlant checks above the tile** - Detects plants in the air 5. **WaterPlant checks above the tile** - Finds plants to water
---
## ✅ YOU'RE READY!
Just create your 3 sprites for each seed type, import them with the settings above, and assign them to your ItemData!
The system will automatically: - Show small sprite when planted - Change to medium sprite halfway through growth - Change to large sprite when fully grown - Keep all sprites visible above the ground
**Your sprites will now work perfectly!** ✨

option.name: updatedContent
option.value:
# FARMING SYSTEM - VISUAL REFERENCE
## SCRIPT DEPENDENCIES
``` ┌─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ GAME SCENE │ ├─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┤ │ │ │ ┌───────────────┐ ┌────────────────┐ │ │ │ GameManager │ │ PlayerWallet │ │ │ │ - Day/Night │ │ - Money: 500 │ │ │ │ - Sun Rotate │ └────────────────┘ │ │ └───────────────┘ ▲ │ │ │ │ │ ┌──────────────────────────────────────────────────┐ │ │ │ InventoryManager (Singleton) │ │ │ │ - Seeds: List<SeedInventoryEntry> │ │ │ │ - Weapons: List<ItemData> │ │ │ │ + AddSeed(ItemData, int) │ │ │ │ + RemoveSeed(ItemData, int) │ │ │ │ + GetSeedQuantity(ItemData) → int │ │ │ └──────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ │ │ ▲ ▲ ▲ │ │ │ │ │ │ │ ┌────────┴──────┐ ┌───────┴───────┐ ┌───────┴────────┐ │ │ │ SeedShopMgr │ │ DayNightSelect│ │ GameGrid │ │ │ │ - Buy seeds │ │ - Show seeds │ │ - Plant seeds │ │ │ │ - Spend $ │ │ - Cycle items │ │ - Water plants │ │ │ └───────────────┘ └───────────────┘ └────────────────┘ │ │ │ │ │ │ │ ▼ │ │ │ ┌─────────────────┐ │ │ │ │ PlantGrowth │ │ │ │ │ - Initialize │ │ │ │ │ - Water() │ │ │ │ │ - Grow timer │ │ │ │ └─────────────────┘ │ │ │ │ │ ▼ │ │ ┌──────────────┐ │ │ │ ItemData │ │ │ │ (ScriptableO)│ │ │ │ - Name, Icon │ │ │ │ - Sprites │ │ │ │ - Cost, Sell │ │ │ └──────────────┘ │ │ │ └─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────┘ ```
---
## DATA FLOW
### **BUY SEED:** ``` User clicks "Buy" on seed ↓ SeedShopManager.OnBuySeed() ↓ PlayerWallet.Spend(cost) → true/false ↓ (if true) InventoryManager.AddSeed(seed, 1) ↓ DayNightSelector.RefreshInventory() ↓ UI updates: icon, name, count ```
### **PLANT SEED:** ``` Player walks near farmland ↓ GameGrid.CheckTileUnderPlayer() ↓ Raycast detects "grid" tag ↓ ShowButton("Plant [SeedName] (x5)") ↓ (user clicks) GameGrid.PlantSeed() ↓ Get selected: DayNightSelector.GetCurrentItem() ↓ Check inventory: InventoryManager.GetSeedQuantity() ↓ Remove: InventoryManager.RemoveSeed(seed, 1) ↓ Destroy grass tile ↓ Instantiate PlantPrefab ↓ PlantGrowth.Initialize(ItemData) ↓ DayNightSelector.RefreshInventory() ↓ UI updates: count decreases ```
### **WATER & GROW:** ``` Player walks near plant ↓ GameGrid.CheckTileUnderPlayer() ↓ HasPlant() detects "Plant" tag ↓ ShowButton("Water") ↓ (user clicks) GameGrid.WaterPlant() ↓ PlantGrowth.Water() ↓ isWatered = true ↓ PlantGrowth.Update() starts timer ↓ 50% time → sprite = growingPhaseSprite ↓ 100% time → sprite = grownPhaseSprite ↓ (if turret seed) Instantiate(turretPrefab) Destroy(plant) ```
---
## ️ SCENE HIERARCHY
``` Hierarchy ├─ GameManager ├─ InventoryManager ├─ PlayerWallet ├─ GridManager ├─ ShopManager ├─ Player │ └─ (your player scripts) ├─ Directional Light (Sun) ├─ Canvas │ ├─ SeedWeaponSelector (DayNightSelector) │ │ ├─ Icon (Image) │ │ ├─ ItemName (TextMeshPro) │ │ └─ CounterText (TextMeshPro) │ ├─ ️ ShopPanel │ │ ├─ Title (TextMeshPro) │ │ ├─ ScrollView │ │ │ └─ Viewport │ │ │ └─ Content (ItemListParent) │ │ └─ CloseButton │ ├─ OpenShopButton │ └─ ✅ ActionButton │ └─ ButtonText (TextMeshPro) └─ Main Camera ```
---
## PREFABS STRUCTURE
### **GrassTile Prefab:** ``` GrassTile ├─ MeshRenderer (or SpriteRenderer) ├─ BoxCollider └─ Tag: "grid" ```
### **PlantPrefab:** ``` PlantPrefab ├─ SpriteRenderer (sprite set by script) ├─ PlantGrowth (script) ├─ BoxCollider └─ Tag: "Plant" ```
### **ShopItemUI Prefab:** ``` ShopItemUI (Panel) ├─ ShopItemUI (script) ├─ Icon (Image) ├─ NameText (TextMeshPro) ├─ PriceText (TextMeshPro) └─ BuyButton (Button) ```
---
## PROJECT STRUCTURE
``` Assets ├─ Resources │ └─ Seeds │ ├─ CarrotSeed (ItemData) │ ├─ PumpkinSeed (ItemData) │ └─ TurretSeed (ItemData) ├─ Prefabs │ ├─ GrassTile │ ├─ PlantPrefab │ └─ ️ ShopItemUI ├─ Scripts │ ├─ Grid │ │ ├─ GameGrid.cs ✅ │ │ ├─ PlantGrowth.cs ✅ │ │ ├─ PlantPrefabHelper.cs │ │ └─ GridSpawner.cs │ ├─ Player │ │ └─ Inventory │ │ ├─ InventoryManager.cs ✅ │ │ ├─ ItemData.cs ✅ │ │ ├─ PlayerWallet.cs ✅ │ │ ├─ DayNightSeletor.cs ✅ │ │ ├─ SeedShopManager.cs ✅ │ │ └─ ShopItemUI.cs ✅ │ ├─ Testing │ │ └─ FarmingSystemTester.cs │ └─ GameManager.cs ✅ └─ Sprites ├─ Seeds ├─ Plants └─ UI ```

## INSPECTOR REFERENCE
### **GameGrid Component:** ``` ┌─────────────────────────────────────┐ │ Game Grid (Script) │ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Grid 1 │ │ Column Length 3 │ │ Row Length 3 │ │ X Space 1.5 │ │ Z Space 1.5 │ │ Grid Start Position (-8.42, 0, 11.9) │ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Grid 2 │ │ Column Length 2 3 │ │ Row Length 2 3 │ │ X Space 2 1.5 │ │ Z Space 2 1.5 │ │ Grid Start Position 2 (5, 0, 11.9)│ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Grass [GrassTile] │ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ UI │ │ Action Button [Button] │ │ Button Text [Text] │ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Player │ │ Player [Transform] │ │ Raycast Distance 2 │ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Planting System │ │ Day Night Selector [Selector] │ │ Plant Prefab [PlantPfb] │ └─────────────────────────────────────┘ ```
### **SeedShopManager Component:** ``` ┌─────────────────────────────────────┐ │ Seed Shop Manager (Script) │ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ UI References │ │ Shop Panel [Panel] │ │ Item List Parent [Content] │ │ Shop Item Prefab [ShopItemUI] │ │ Day Night Selector [Selector] │ └─────────────────────────────────────┘ ```
### **DayNightSelector Component:** ``` ┌─────────────────────────────────────┐ │ Day Night Selector (Script) │ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ UI References │ │ Button Icon [Image] │ │ Button Background [Image] │ │ Select Button [Button] │ │ Item Counter Text [Text] │ │ Item Name Text [Text] │ ├─────────────────────────────────────┤ │ Visual Settings │ │ Day Color (1,0.9,0.4) │ │ Night Color (0.2,0.2,0.5)│ │ Transition Duration 0.3 │ └─────────────────────────────────────┘ ```
---
## ⚙️ TAGS REQUIRED
Make sure these tags exist: - ✅ **"grid"** → For farmland tiles - ✅ **"Plant"** → For planted crops
**How to create tags:** 1. Select any GameObject 2. Inspector → Tag dropdown → "Add Tag..." 3. Click "+" and type tag name 4. Save
---
## TESTING CHECKLIST
### **Phase 1: Setup (Not Running Yet)** - [ ] All scripts compile (no errors) - [ ] 2+ ItemData seeds in Resources/Seeds/ - [ ] GrassTile prefab has "grid" tag - [ ] PlantPrefab has "Plant" tag - [ ] All scene GameObjects created - [ ] All Inspector references assigned
### **Phase 2: Runtime Test** - [ ] ▶️ Press Play → No errors - [ ] Grids spawn (18 tiles) - [ ] Sun rotates - [ ] Selector shows seed (if any in inventory)
### **Phase 3: Shop Test** - [ ] Open shop → Seeds appear - [ ] Buy seed → Money decreases - [ ] Selector updates → Shows new seed - [ ] Close shop → Works
### **Phase 4: Farming Test** - [ ] Walk to tile → Highlights yellow - [ ] Button shows → "Plant [Name] (x5)" - [ ] Click Plant → Grass disappears - [ ] Plant spawns → Shows planted sprite - [ ] Selector updates → Count decreases (x4)
### **Phase 5: Growth Test** - [ ] Walk to plant → "Water" button - [ ] Click Water → Button hides - [ ] Wait 15s → Sprite changes (growing) - [ ] Wait 15s → Sprite changes (grown) - [ ] If turret → Turret spawns
---
